botanical_details.genus: Rosa can be deciduous or semi-evergreen shrubs or scrambling climbers, with usually thorny stems bearing compound pinnate leaves and solitary or clustered flowers. Flowers may be followed by showy red or purple fruits in some varieties.
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Shrub roses are large shrubs with usually thorny stems bearing large leaves and fragrant, single to double flowers in clusters in summer, and usually also in autumn

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in full sun with fertile, humus-rich, moist but well-drained soil. For best flowering apply a balanced fertiliser and mulch in late winter or early spring and a balanced fertiliser again in early summer. Will tolerate some shade and can be grown as a short climber. See rose cultivation with further information
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by hardwood cuttings in autumn or by T-budding in summer
how_to_grow.pests: Rose aphid, rose leafhopper, scale insects, caterpillars, large rose sawfly and rose leaf-rolling sawfly may be a problem; rabbits and deer can cause damage
how_to_grow.diseases: May be subject to rose blindness, rose dieback, black spot, rose rust, rose powdery mildew and a downy mildew
